comments:
Replicate by running STEM with the -ea flag and then starting the world-wide Spanish Flu scenario.  You'll get errors
in the Error Log view.

java.lang.AssertionError
at org.eclipse.ohf.stem.core.common.impl.IdentifiableImpl.sane(IdentifiableImpl.java:218)
at org.eclipse.ohf.stem.core.scenario.impl.ScenarioImpl.sane(ScenarioImpl.java:512)
at org.eclipse.ohf.stem.jobs.simulation.Simulation.run(Simulation.java:198)
at org.eclipse.core.internal.jobs.Worker.run(Worker.java:58)

I believe the problem is that a URI for an identifiable is not correct.

java.lang.AssertionError: stem://org.eclipse.ohf.stem/node/geo/region/SE-SE-UNK-3
	at org.eclipse.ohf.stem.core.graph.impl.LabelImpl.sane(LabelImpl.java:312)
	at org.eclipse.ohf.stem.core.graph.impl.StaticNodeLabelImpl.sane(StaticNodeLabelImpl.java:232)
	at org.eclipse.ohf.stem.core.graph.impl.GraphImpl.sane(GraphImpl.java:611)
	at org.eclipse.ohf.stem.core.scenario.impl.ScenarioImpl.initialize(ScenarioImpl.java:313)
	at org.eclipse.ohf.stem.core.scenario.impl.ScenarioImpl.step(ScenarioImpl.java:239)
	at org.eclipse.ohf.stem.jobs.simulation.Simulation.run(Simulation.java:239)
	at org.eclipse.core.internal.jobs.Worker.run(Worker.java:58)

The assertion error in IdentifiableImpl.sane can safely be commented out as it is testing that the "type" of the identifiable is "sane".  The type isn't fully thought out (by me), but is used in at least one place so it can't just be removed.  The rest of the sanity checks pass so will ignore this error for now to let the other stuff run and them maybe revisit the issue when we're happy with the type semantics.
